snippet: Eleven percent growth in profit at General Electric’s divisions that make aircraft engines, CT scanners and gas turbines helped the company exceed analysts’ expectations.
abstract: General Electric reports third quarter profit of $3.19 billion, or 31 cents per share, down from $3.49 billion, or 33 cents a share in year-earlier period; revenue fell 1 percent to $35.73 billion, down from $36.3 billion year earlier; results still exceed analyst expectation, largely on growth at company's industrial divisions.
lead_paragraph: Eleven percent growth in profit at General Electric’s divisions that make aircraft engines, CT scanners and gas turbines helped the company exceed analysts’ expectations.

headline.main: G.E. Beats Expectations With Help of Industrial Units
headline.print_headline: G.E. Beats Expectations With Help of Industrial Units
